content: this mosaic hat is perfect for the knitter who has experience making a basic beanie-style hat and is feeling ready to experience mosaic colorwork this hat pattern provides the perfect palate for that this project is knit in the round starting with familiar 1x1 ribbing moving to a garter stitch mosaic chart and ending with a short simple crown decrease the mosaic chart is worked one color at a time and uses simple equally familiar stitches knit purl and slipped the crown decreases are executed using ssk slip slip knit to create a left leaning swirl effect and after you cinche those final stitches you can add a pom-pom tassel or go bare letting the mosaic pattern tell the whole story whatever you choose to do we highly recommend choosing two highly contrasting colorways for the best results when using this pattern this pattern was part of the fort vancouver knitters guild 2025 kal and class for our biannual knitting retreat if you live in vancouver wa or portland or or surrounding areas feel free to check us out here 1 all are welcome **specifications** **sizes ** adult xs/s m/l xl **finished dimensions ** finished hat circumference 18 20 22 inches finished hat length from crown to earlobe 8 8 5 9 inches to fit head circumferences 19-20 21-22 23-24 inches to be worn with 1-2 of negative ease **gauge ** 20sts/42rds/4 inches in mosaic chart wet blocked 20sts/32rds/4inches in stockinette stitch wet blocked **estimate yardage ** **mc** 46g/115yds / 50g/125yds / 55g/138yds **cc** 23g/55yds / 24g/60 yds / 25g/63yds **suggested yarn ** **this pattern requires 2 colors** we recommend choosing contrasting colors in a similar dk or worsted weight yarn that achieves gauge can be substituted 100% wool yarn with a nice spring to it is recommended to best show the colorwork while maintaining spring for the ribbing **samples were knit using ** **knitted wit victory dk** in colorways tree bark mc and tugboat cc victory dk has been replaced by knitted wit dk **knit picks swish dk** in colorways cobblestone mc and karma heather 2 cc **coates & co studio dk superwash merino** in colorways dark teal mc and bright peach cc other recommended yarns **berroco ultrawool dk** **malabrigo rios** **needles ** **us6/4mm 16 inch circulars or a size or two down to firm up the brim more elastic** this pattern is written assuming circular needles and dpns but you may use magic loop method **us6/4mm dpns** or any combination of needles and yarn that achieve gauge **can opt for a needle size down to tighten ribbing as desired** **notions ** **1 stitch marker** to mark the beginning of the round **and 8 9 10 stitch markers** to delineate colorwork repeats darning needle scissors waste yarn here is a helpful article on mosaic knitting in-the-round over at interweave knits https //www interweave com/article/knitting/tech-tip-mosaic-knitting/ this pattern has been tested slightly_smiling_face 1 https //fvkg clubexpress com/
